oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Detection of iatrogenic defects during semen evaluation: A review
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Koziol, Jennifer H.
Armstrong, Chance L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bulls
semen
sperm morphology
iatrognic defects
breeding soundness exam
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: During routine evaluation of semen, veterinarians may en­counter iatrogenically derived sperm defects. It is important to recognize that these sperm defects are the result of han­dling of semen and veterinarians should aim to differentiate iatrogenic defects from similar sperm defects that are a result of imperfections in the spermatogenesis process. In this re­view article we will discuss the most commonly encountered iatrogenic defects including cold shock, hypo-osmotic shock, bowed midpieces and detached heads.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: The Bovine Practitioner; Vol. 60 No. 1 (2026): ONLINE FIRST; 33-37
